1.name: Saving Private Ryan
1.description: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

2.name: The Big Lebowski
2.description: Jeff "The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire of the same name, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it.

3.name: Deep Impact
3.description: Unless a comet can be destroyed before colliding with Earth, only those allowed into shelters will survive. Which people will survive?

4.name: American History X
4.description: A former neo-nazi skinhead tries to prevent his younger brother from going down the same wrong path that he did.

5.name: A Bug's Life
5.description: A misfit ant, looking for "warriors" to save his colony from greedy grasshoppers, recruits a group of bugs that turn out to be an inept circus troupe.

6.name: Mulan
6.description: To save her father from death in the army, a young maiden secretly goes in his place and becomes one of China's greatest heroines in the process.

7.name: The Truman Show
7.description: An insurance salesman discovers his whole life is actually a reality TV show.

8.name: Enemy of the State
8.description: A lawyer becomes a target by a corrupt politician and his N.S.A. goons when he accidentally receives key evidence to a serious politically motivated crime.

9.name: Armageddon
9.description: After discovering that an asteroid the size of Texas is going to impact Earth in less than a month, N.A.S.A. recruits a misfit team of deep core drillers to save the planet.

10.name: There's Something About Mary
10.description: A man gets a chance to meet up with his dream girl from high school, even though his date with her back then was a complete disaster.

11.name: Blade
11.description: A half-vampire, half-mortal man becomes a protector of the mortal race, while slaying evil vampires.

12.name: Meet Joe Black
12.description: Death, who takes the form of a young man (Brad Pitt), asks a media mogul (Sir Anthony Hopkins) to act as a guide to teach him about life on Earth, and in the process, he falls in love with his guide's daughter (Claire Forlani).

13.name: The Parent Trap
13.description: Identical twins Annie and Hallie, separated at birth and each raised by one of their biological parents, later discover each other for the first time at summer camp and make a plan to bring their wayward parents back together.

14.name: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
14.description: A botched card game in London triggers four friends, thugs, weed-growers, hard gangsters, loan sharks and debt collectors to collide with each other in a series of unexpected events, all for the sake of weed, cash and two antique shotguns.

15.name: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
15.description: An oddball journalist and his psychopathic lawyer travel to Las Vegas for a series of psychedelic escapades.

16.name: The Thin Red Line
16.description: Adaptation of James Jones' autobiographical 1962 novel, focusing on the conflict at Guadalcanal during the second World War.

17.name: Wild Things
17.description: A police detective uncovers a conspiracy behind a case involving a high-school guidance counselor when accusations of rape are made against him by two female students.

18.name: The Waterboy
18.description: A waterboy for a college football team discovers he has a unique tackling ability and becomes a member of the team.

19.name: Bride of Chucky
19.description: Chucky, the doll possessed by a serial killer, discovers the perfect mate to kill and revive into the body of another doll.

20.name: The Faculty
20.description: Students suspect that their teachers are aliens after bizarre occurrences.

21.name: EverAfter
21.description: The Brothers Grimm arrive at the home of a wealthy Grande Dame who speaks of the many legends surrounding the fable of the cinder girl before telling the "true" story of her ancestor.

22.name: Rush Hour
22.description: A loyal and dedicated Hong Kong Inspector teams up with a reckless and loudmouthed L.A.P.D. detective to rescue the Chinese Consul's kidnapped daughter, while trying to arrest a dangerous crime lord along the way.

23.name: Godzilla
23.description: A giant, reptilian monster surfaces, leaving destruction in its wake as it strides into New York City. To stop it, an earthworm scientist, his reporter ex-girlfriend, and other unlikely heroes team up to save their city.

24.name: Fallen
24.description: Homicide detective John Hobbes witnesses the execution of serial killer Edgar Reese. Soon after the execution the killings start again, and they are very similar to Reese's style.

25.name: The Man in the Iron Mask
25.description: The cruel King Louis XIV of France has a secret twin brother whom he keeps imprisoned. Can the twin be substituted for the real king?

26.name: The Wedding Singer
26.description: Robbie, a singer, and Julia, a waitress, are both engaged, but to the wrong people. Fortune intervenes to help them discover each other.

27.name: Practical Magic
27.description: Two witch sisters, raised by their eccentric aunts in a small town, face closed-minded prejudice and a curse which threatens to prevent them ever finding lasting love.

28.name: Small Soldiers
28.description: When missile technology is used to enhance toy action figures, the toys soon begin to take their battle programming too seriously.

29.name: Blues Brothers 2000
29.description: Elwood must reunite the old band, with a few new members, and go on another "Mission from God."

30.name: Ronin
30.description: A freelancing former U.S. Intelligence Agent tries to track down a mysterious package that is wanted by the Irish and the Russians.

31.name: Elizabeth
31.description: The early years of the reign of Elizabeth I of England and her difficult task of learning what is necessary to be a monarch.

32.name: You've Got Mail
32.description: Two business rivals who despise each other in real life unwittingly fall in love over the Internet.

33.name: Shakespeare in Love
33.description: A young Shakespeare, out of ideas and short of cash, meets his ideal woman and is inspired to write one of his most famous plays.

34.name: Patch Adams
34.description: The true story of a heroic man, Hunter "Patch" Adams, determined to become a medical doctor because he enjoys helping people. He ventured where no doctor had ventured before, using humour and pathos.

35.name: Dark City
35.description: A man struggles with memories of his past, which includes a wife he cannot remember, and a nightmarish world without a sun.

36.name: Great Expectations
36.description: Modernization of Charles Dickens classic story finds the hapless Finn as a painter in New York City pursuing his unrequited and haughty childhood love.

37.name: Pleasantville
37.description: Two 1990s teenage siblings find themselves in a 1950s sitcom, where their influence begins to profoundly change that complacent world.

38.name: A Night at the Roxbury
38.description: Two dim-witted brothers dream of owning their own dance club or at least getting into the coolest and most exclusive club in town, The Roxbury.

39.name: Soldier
39.description: A soldier trained from birth is deemed obsolete and dumped on a waste planet where he is reluctantly taken in by a community of defenseless, stranded wayfarers.

40.name: Species II
40.description: An astronaut gets infected with alien DNA during the first mission on Mars and runs amok on earth. Preston and Laura team up with a peaceful, genetically re-engineered Sil to track the monster down.

41.name: The Mask of Zorro
41.description: A young thief (Antonio Banderas), seeking revenge for the death of his brother, is trained by the once great, but aged Zorro (Sir Anthony Hopkins), who also pursues vengeance of his own.

42.name: What Dreams May Come
42.description: Chris Nielsen dies in car crash one night, and then goes to Heaven. Later, his widow Annie commits suicide, unable to overcome her loss. Chris descends into Hell to save her.

43.name: Out of Sight
43.description: A career bank robber breaks out of jail, and shares a moment of mutual attraction with a U.S. Marshal he has kidnapped.

44.name: Rounders
44.description: A young, reformed gambler must return to playing big stakes poker to help a friend pay off loan sharks, while balancing his relationship with his girlfriend and his commitments to law school.

45.name: The Prince of Egypt
45.description: An Egyptian prince learns of his identity as a Hebrew and his destiny to become the chosen deliverer of his people.

46.name: Can't Hardly Wait
46.description: Multicharacter teenage comedy about high school graduates with different agenda of life on graduation night.

47.name: Stepmom
47.description: A terminally ill woman has to settle on her former husband's new lover, who will be their children's stepmother.

48.name: Six Days Seven Nights
48.description: Robin Monroe, a New York magazine editor, and the gruff pilot Quinn Harris must put aside their mutual dislike if they are to survive after crash landing on a deserted South Seas island.

49.name: Lethal Weapon 4
49.description: With personal crises and age weighing in on them, LAPD officers Riggs and Murtaugh must contend with deadly Chinese triads that are trying to free their former leaders out of prison and onto American soil.

50.name: Disturbing Behavior
50.description: The new kid in Cradle Bay, Washington stumbles across something sinister about the town's method of transforming its unruly teens into upstanding citizens.
